alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 22 at 2:24PM MDT until April 24 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT MDT SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy, wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph could create near blizzard conditions at times. * WHERE...Converse and Niobrara Counties in east-central Wyoming including Douglas, Bill, and Lusk. * WHEN...From 12 AM MDT Saturday to 12 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could blow down trees and power lines.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County
